titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the James Henry Carleton Papers : typescript transcripts of letters and reports, 1851-1865 M0006

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2009-08-04T09:04-0700

did.unittitle: James Henry Carleton Papers : typescript transcripts of letters and reports,

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

scopecontent.head: SCOPE AND CONTENT
scopecontent.p: Transcripts made by Clarence Clemens Clendenen, ca. 1958. Originals held by the Library of Congress.
Summary: Reports, documents, and notes written by or pertaining to James Henry Carleton. Includes information on Indian wars, the Mountain Meadows Massacre, and the Civil War in the Southwest.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHY
bioghist.p: Army officer in California and the southwest.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] James Henry Carleton Papers : typescript transcripts of letters and reports, M0006, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights:
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.
